Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.14) Gecko/20110218 Firefox/3.6.14

Since the new update that I just got when I shutdown Firefox it won't close all the way so when I try to re-open Firefox it says its already running in the background and I have to end it every time through the task manager

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Close Firefox
2. Open Firefox
3. Error comes up saying its already running
4. Open task manager and end firefox.exe
Actual Results:  
I can re open firefox perfectly but it has to be ended every time

Expected Results:  
It should close and reopen without lingering in the background

comments.raw_text: I had this problem on Linux with Firefox 29. Then it went away for no reason.

I've been having this problem on CentOS 6/RHEL 6 for about 2 years now:

Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:42.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/42.0

Most times that I shut down Firefox (clicking on the 'X' or using the keyboard shortcut to quit) the process will keep running, and I need to manually kill the process in order to be able to start another Firefox instance.
